articles.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures hit pause after record-setting rally
articles.content: US stock futures held steady after President Trump visited the Federal Reserve and Wall Street digested the latest batch of corporate earnings.

articles.title: FCC Approves Paramount’s $8 Billion Merger With Skydance
articles.content: The signoff on the deal, which could close next month, follows Paramount’s settlement of a Trump lawsuit.

articles.title: Fidelity OTC Portfolio Q2 2025 Commentary
articles.content: Fidelity Investments reports a 16.2% Q2 gain for its OTC Portfolio, fueled by AI-driven tech picks. Explore how durable growth shapes their strategy.

articles.title: Stocks Close at Record as Alphabet Fuels AI Hopes: Markets Wrap
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Stocks closed at all-time highs as Alphabet Inc.’s results showed solid demand for artificial intelligence, bolstering confidence in the technology that has powered the bull market. articles.title: Alphabet Boosted by AI, Cloud Demand
articles.content: Needham & Company Senior Analyst Laura Martin breaks down Alphabet's major boost fueled by strong growth in AI and Cloud. She discusses Apple's 'product-insurance' plan debut, as Meta continues its hiring spree, poaching two more key Apple AI experts. Martin goes on to commend Apple CEO Tim Cook, though posits he "hasnt been great at this technological disruption called generative AI." She joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on "Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' in New York on Thursday, July 24

articles.title: Google is getting a boost from AI after spending billions
articles.content: Google is pouring even more money into its AI efforts, but it's starting to pay off.

articles.title: Spotify Stock Rises After Upgrade. The Case for Buying Before Earnings.
articles.content: Spotify Technology  stock was rising Thursday after Oppenheimer upgraded shares of the music-streaming company, saying it is confident there is even more room for growth ahead.  Analyst Jason Helfstein raised his call on the stock to Outperform from Perform and set a target of $800 for the price.  Spotify stock has outperformed the broader market this year, climbing 54% compared with the  8.5% rise.
